name: The Lodge at Garden of the Gods Club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an amazing place with gorgeous views, exquisite accomodations, fabulous food and a very friendly, helpful staff. I literally stumbled on this place while planning a trip to Denver, Co to visit our son. My husband had suggested we drive down to view Pikes Peak. I happened to see this place on tripadvisor and became intrigued with the Garden of the Gods. We decided to take a chance and it turned out to be an incredible decision. Actually, we would have loved to have stayed for a few days, some for sight seeing in the nearby area and a couple of days for lingering on the property at the Lodge. The gorgeous suites were roomy, more like an apartment with a lovely terrace, fireplace, sitting area, huge flat screen tv, dressing room with walk in closet, huge bathroom! We enjoyed a delicious dinner, probably the best in the 8 day trip and a hardy breakfast.
reviews.title: Put This On Your BUCKET List!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I contacted the Lodge directly after reviewing on line and made our over night reservations expaining that we would be driving from the Denver airport. The staff person made my reservations, assisted with directions, made great suggestions regarding route, even advising about the rental car and the toll road charges (huge help), arranged a room upgrade....amazing assistance. After arriving in Denver, getting our rental car...we knew the correct route to take and the route to avoid excessive charges due to the assistance offered by the staffer at the Lodge. The drive was approximately 1.5 hours and so very beautiful. We drove down in the middle of the afternoon and thoroughly enjoyed viewing the countryside. It was a great way to start our trip. We were amazed with the beauty of the terrain in this area of the state of Colorado. As we approached the Lodge at the Garden of the Gods, we were both speechless! Of course, coming from the east coast much more accustomed to the Great Smoky Mountain area, this scenery was mesmerizing. We drove up to the Lodge and entered the lobby continuing to gasp at the absolute astouding beauty of this place. After a smooth check in, we continued on to the room and could not believe how lovely this location was and how lucky we felt to be staying here. I walked through the large room to the terrace which overlooked the "Kissing Camels". Again, coming from the east coast, this view was simply stunning! I sat down at the table on our terrace and watched the bunnies scurry around the landscape. It was divine!
reviews.title: Can't Beat The View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to have dinner there after quite a long day and did not really care too much about the prospects. WOW! We had a relaxing cocktail, continuing to admire the views and chatting with our delightful server. The menu was "well done" and not at all difficult to navigate. Our server did an awesome job of accomodating and anticpating...her suggestions were spot on! My salmon was perfectly prepared.....am I in Colorado???? All of the staff in the restaurant, we were in the casual area, seemed to know most of the guests and I just wanted to stay forever! Every detail was amazing and I will never forget the fabulous beginning to my wonderful Colorado vacation.
reviews.title: Beautiful view but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next morning we packed up to tour the area but not before a wonderful, hardy breakfast. Prices were reasonable and even though there are many fabulous restaurants in this area that I would want to try if I were there for a few days, you will be very satisfied if time is limited as it was with us.
reviews.title: Best view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was very surprised at how convenient the Lodge is to so many incredible things to see and do. We started off the day with a drive through and short stops at the Garden of the Gods, then on to Manitou Springs, drove up Pikes Peak to Switchback (as far as possible due to winds), then to Old Colorado City. It was a fun filled day. I wish I had a full week to enjoy the exquisite beauty of this area. It indeed is heavenly and does make you want to sing...purple mountain majesty!
reviews.title: Beautiful scenary is all you need

reviews.text: We flew to Colorado Springs to spend the Christmas holiday with family in Salida - about a 2 hour drive to the mountains. Because we were tired upon arriving at Colorado Springs, we at the last minute decided to stay the night in Colorado Springs to travel up to the mountains the next morning. And thanks to the Tripadvisor app (and I kid you not that this is not a Tripadvisor advertisement) we located this lodge at the Garden of the Gods club on our phone and made a reservation through this app before we left the airplane - it was pretty awesome.
reviews.title: Colorado Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I guess we didn't realize that we made a reservation at a "country club" because when we arrived, we were caught off-guard by the grandeur of the place. The lobby - or main area - was all wood and leather - decked out with holiday gear - with a huge fireplace with comfy chairs surrounding it. To the left of that was large bar and restaurant where we had nightcap and fries drenched in cheese and chili (yum). The rooms to the right are on two floors in a motel-style lay out. Our room was enormous, with a comfy king-size bed and a fireplace and two sink bathroom. The bed was heaven - we slept like kings.
reviews.title: Once again, an enjoyable stay

reviews.text: We didn't know what "garden of the gods" referred to - and when we woke up the next morning, we saw what this title meant. Gorgeous red rock mountains awaited us outside our room window. Behind the gigantic window, we found a balcony with a table and chairs looking out to the mountains. We wished that we could take the day to explore the garden of the gods ..... but we had to hit the road as we had family waiting. And we wanted to take advantage of the gym before hitting the road. We knew from the pictures of the gym in the lobby that we wanted to get our full money's worth - though I should add that the cost of the one night stay was unbelievably inexpensive, probably due to the time of the year.
reviews.title: Fabulous and Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next time we come down to Colorado Springs to visit our siblings who live in Salida, we will build in time to spend at the Garden of The Gods lodge to enjoy the lodge and to explore the garden of the gods mountains. As you can see, we highly enjoyed our quick little stay here.
reviews.title: Warm Welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We live about two hours north of the hotel and frequently come here for special occasions. The staff is always first rate, and I love the breakfast and the surroundings. A lot cheaper than the Broadmoor and a bit different experience, but I like the Garden of the Gods Club better. Last time we were there we got upgraded from the standard room the master suite just because of availability--and then they brought us chocolate covered strawberries and Brut. Wow!
reviews.title: Garden of the Gods Club-Best Customer Service

Awesome place!
reviews.text: We stayed here for a Thanksgiving getaway. We got a very good deal because the place was pretty empty. First of all, the view of the Garden of the Gods you see on the web site is what you see from your patio or balcony. We got there at night so we didn't see it until the next morning at 6am when the sun came up. WOW! what a view! Also we had mule deer and rabbits right by our patio! I have only one complaint about this great place.....please remind people about the $15/day service fee when they check in. We had forgotten about it until check out. Not a big deal, but maybe include it in the nightly rate. $15/day for Internet, newspaper and bottled water? Ummmm ok.
We enjoyed the heated pool too even though the outside temps were in the 50's and 60's!
reviews.title: Garden of the Gods Club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night for a wedding. The South Patio king room was very large, loved the patio entrance, tons of pillows on bed, two luggage stands was nice, and views were incredible. Staff was very friendly. The buffet food at the wedding was fine, nothing spectacular, but that's typical for buffets, not indicitive of the restaurant itself. Great 100% agave margaritas from the bartender.
reviews.title: Romantic getaway :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and the wife went for our anniversary and had a great time. The rooms, the view and the staff were all wonderful. Susie was especially nice and thoughtful. We were upgraded without asking and also sent some treats to the room. We could not have been happier with this choice of lodging.
reviews.title: WOW!!!

reviews.text: My wife & I plus our service dog... had an Awesome getaway weekend. Yes! Our room was really nice to include a beautiful view of "The Kissing Camels". The "Wait" Staff in the restaurant were very polite... KUDO'S to Montana! Their golf course for this time of year (November), was well maintained and in excellant condition. Afterwards, we both had a Superb massage! Gandolf says, "Bow-WOW"!!! For the Colorado Springs area, The Lodge At The Garden Of The Gods IS The Only Choice!
reviews.title: Great service, great room, and spectaular view!

aka: The Lodge At Garden Of The Gods Club, Colorado Springs Hotel Colorado Springs
description: Located in the heart of Colorado Springs, The Garden of the Gods Club and Resort is a 69-room legendary golf and spa resort boasting breathtaking views of Pikes Peak and the red rock formations of the Garden of the Gods National Landmark. Guests have complete access to all of Garden of the Gods Club and Resort’s amenities, which include fine and casual dining, a state-of-the-art sports club, a spa and salon, a 27-hole golf course, tennis courts, and swimming pools. All guest rooms feature a dramatic view of Garden of the Gods and Pikes Peak from either a private patio or balcony and include a refrigerator, coffee maker and bath robes. Wireless Internet access and daily newspaper delivery are included in the resort fee. The Club and Resort is also a retreat for weddings, social events, and executive meetings. During your stay at Garden of the Gods Club and Resort, you can be as active or as pampered as you desire. Take advantage of the sports club’s wide variety of fitness equipment and group exercise classes, hit the nearby walking trails, or get a golf or tennis lesson from our PGA or USPTA-certified professionals. The full-service spa and salon offers massages, facials, body treatments, manicures and pedicures, hair care services, and luxurious retail products, and the cuisine served in The Club and Resort's dining room rivals that of some of the finest restaurants in larger cities. Additional dining options include The Lounge and, on a seasonal basis, Kissing Camels Grille at the golf clubhouse. The Garden of the Gods Club and Resort is conveniently located within five miles of many popular Colorado Springs attractions, including Garden of the Gods Park, the Rock Ledge Ranch historic site, the Colorado Springs Fine Arts Center and the Old Colorado City shopping district.
